How to Cultivate: Wheat is cultivated in well-drained loamy soil with good fertility. Plant seeds in rows with proper spacing.
How to Harvest: Harvest mature wheat kernels using combine harvesters.

How to Cultivate: Rice requires flooded clayey soil and warm, tropical climate.
How to Harvest: Rice paddies are flooded to allow for easy harvesting.

How to Cultivate: Maize needs warm climate with plenty of sunlight.
How to Harvest: Ears of corn are harvested by hand or with machines.

How to Harvest: Soybean pods are harvested using mechanical harvesters.

How to Harvest: Harvest barley when kernels are firm and dry.

How to Harvest: Harvest potatoes by digging carefully to avoid damage.

How to Harvest: Harvest cotton bolls when they are fully mature.

How to Harvest: Harvest sugarcane by cutting the stalks close to ground.

How to Harvest: Harvest corn when kernels are plump and milky.

Fertilizer Requirements: Balanced fertilizer with higher potassium content.

How to Cultivate: Plant cucumber seeds or seedlings in fertile, well-drained soil with good sunlight.
How to Harvest: Harvest cucumbers when they are firm and dark green.
Water Requirements: Regular watering, keeping the soil consistently moist.
Fertilizer Requirements: Balanced fertilizer with emphasis on nitrogen.

Varieties: Crimson Sweet, Sugar Baby, Yellow Doll
How to Cultivate: Plant watermelon seeds in warm soil with plenty of sunlight and space.
How to Harvest: Harvest watermelons when the tendrils dry out, and the fruit has a hollow sound.
Water Requirements: Frequent watering, especially during dry spells.
Fertilizer Requirements: Rich, well-draining soil with balanced nutrients.
Suitable Growing Areas: Warm and hot regions with a long growing season
